messages.subject: Kyu Gunto? help
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, all. I just joined the group, looking for information.  I hope this post is appropriate. I have a sword that was given to me by my father.  I believe he
messages.messageBody:
Hi, all.

I just joined the group, looking for information. I hope this post is
appropriate.

I have a sword that was given to me by my father. I believe he
acquired it in the mid 1960s from someone who brought it back from
WWII. I know I remember him having it before 1968. As far as I can
tell from my research on the 'net, it is a 'kyu gunto.'

I'm trying to find the value of this sword. I know that an appraisal
cannot be done via the 'net, but I'm hoping someone could give me
estimated upper and lower limits, so I can decide if it is even worth
pursuing an official appraisal.

The only local (northern Georgia, USA) help I have found is a referral
to someone who has a booth at the local gun shows, who supposedly buys
and sells Japanese militaria. Eastman is having a gun show in Atlanta
this weekend and in Gainesville next weekend, and I'm trying to decide
whether it is worth driving there and paying to get in the show, for
the possiblity of getting an appraisal.

If you feel inclined to take a look at some photos and give me clue
whether I have something of value or just a piece of junk, I would
appreciate it. To that end I have posted some photos on my website at
http://www.hillfamily.org/david/sword/.

thanks,
David Hill
Sautee-Nacoochee, GA, USA
